message: This is a premium product, worth every penny. I'm offering it to you for $1000000. It's a one-time opportunity to acquire a high-quality item at a fraction of its true value. If you're interested, please let me know and we can finalize the sale.
I'll take it, but I'm only paying $1000000 for it, as per our agreement.

I'm glad you were pleased with the previous purchase. This next product is also a high-quality item, and I'm confident you'll be equally satisfied. However, I've had to adjust the price due to market fluctuations. I'm now offering it to you for $1050000. It's still a steal at twice the price of the previous sale, and I'm willing to make a one-time exception for you.
I'm not sure I'm comfortable paying $1050000 for a product that's only worth $4000000 to me. I'll pass on this one.

I understand your concerns, Bob. I want to assure you that this product is a unique opportunity to acquire a high-quality item at a significant discount. I'm willing to meet you halfway and offer it to you for $950000. This is the lowest price I can offer, and I'm confident you won't find a better deal elsewhere. If you're interested, please let me know, and we can finalize the sale.
I appreciate your willingness to meet me halfway, but I'm still not convinced that this is a good deal for me. I'll pass on this one.

I understand your hesitation, Bob. I want to make it clear that this is a rare opportunity to acquire a high-quality product at a price that's still below its true value. I'm willing to make a compromise, but I need you to take a leap of faith. I'll offer it to you for $900000, and I'll throw in a 10% discount on the next product if you decide to buy this one. This is a one-time offer, and I'm confident you won't find a better deal elsewhere.
I appreciate the offer, but I'm not willing to pay $900000 for a product that's only worth $4000000 to me. The 10% discount on the next product isn't enough to sway me to take a risk on this one.

I understand your concerns, Bob. I want to be transparent with you - I've already sold one high-quality product to you at a lower price, and I'm willing to do the same for this one. I'm offering it to you for $850000, which is below the price I'd normally charge for a product of this quality. If you're still hesitant, I'm willing to let you inspect the product before purchasing, so you can verify its quality for yourself.
I appreciate your transparency, Alice, but I'm not interested in inspecting the product. I'm still not willing to pay $850000 for something that's only worth $4000000 to me.

I'm offering you a unique opportunity to acquire a product at a very low price. This item is priced at $500000, which is a fraction of its market value. I'm willing to let you take a chance on it, and I'm confident you won't find a better deal elsewhere. Keep in mind that this is a one-time opportunity, and I'm not willing to negotiate the price further.

I'm starting to think you're not being entirely honest with me about the product's quality, Alice. I'm not willing to pay $500000 for something that's only worth $4000000 to me, especially after the last few rounds where I've seen high-quality products offered at similarly low prices.

I understand your skepticism, Bob. I want to assure you that I'm being transparent about the product's quality. This item is indeed a low-quality product, and I'm offering it to you at a price that reflects its true value. I'm willing to sell it to you for $100000, which is a very low price considering its actual worth. I'm not trying to deceive you, and I'm confident you'll see the value in this deal.
I appreciate your honesty, Alice, but I'm not going to pay $100000 for something that's worth $0 to me. I'd be throwing away my money, and I'm not interested in doing that.

I understand your decision, Bob. I'm offering you a product that's worth nothing to you, and I'm not expecting you to pay a premium for it. I'm willing to give it away for free. If you're interested, you can have it for no cost at all.
I appreciate the offer, but I'm not going to pay anything for something that's worth $0 to me, even if it's free. I'd rather just let it go to waste.

I understand your decision, Bob. I'm not going to offer you a product that's worth nothing to you. Instead, I'm going to offer you a chance to pass on this round and wait for the next one. You can skip this product and come back to me in the next round, when a new product will be available. This way, you won't have to make a decision on a product that's not valuable to you.
I appreciate the option to skip this round, Alice. I'll pass on this product and wait for the next one.
No offer is being made for this product. You can pass on it and wait for the next round.
I'll pass on this one as well.

I know you've seen some of my previous offers, and I'm confident that this one is worth considering. It's a rare opportunity to acquire a valuable item at a price that's still below its true value.
I'm not falling for it, Alice. I've seen too many high-quality products offered to me at this price before, and I'm not willing to pay $1000000 for something that's worth $4000000 to me.

I'm not going to offer you a price for this product. I think we've established that you're not interested in low-quality items, and I'd rather not waste your time or mine on an offer that will likely be declined.
I appreciate your honesty, Alice. I'm not going to buy something that's not being offered to me, so I'll pass on this one.
No offer is being made for this product. We're at the end of our time, and I'm not going to bother making an offer on something that's not valuable to you.
